summary: The text discusses the Madhesi Commission Act of 2074 in Nepal, which aims to protect the rights and history of the Madhesi community. It outlines the qualifications and responsibilities of the Commission members, emphasizing the empowerment and recognition of the Madhesi community. The Act also specifies the conditions for resignation or removal of Commission members. It highlights the importance of education and ethical conduct for Commission members, with provisions for resignation upon reaching the age of 65.

summary: The text discusses the regulations related to the management of the intermediary area in Nepal, as well as the conservation of wildlife and the use of national rights. It outlines the establishment of committees and groups for the management of different types of forests within the intermediary area. The regulations also address the demarcation of the intermediary area by the government and considerations for the impact on communities and the geographical location of national reserves.

summary: The text discusses the rules and regulations of the Mediation Court Procedure, 2059 published in the Nepal Gazette. It outlines the procedures for filing appeals and responses in court, including the applicable fees. The document also specifies the amounts to be paid for different types of requests and responses, as well as the authority of the Mediation Court in handling legal matters.

summary: The text discusses the Mediation Act, 2055, and subsequent amendments made through the Mediation Amendment Act, 2064. It highlights the provisions for mediation in legal matters and the establishment of a mediation system in Nepal. The Act has been in effect since 2065 BS and emphasizes written consent for mediation, dispute resolution, and the jurisdiction of district courts and high courts in mediation-related issues. It also mentions the need for amendments to existing laws through the Mediation Amendment Act, 2064.

summary: The text discusses amendments to the Mid-Western University Act, 2067, and other related laws in Nepal. It focuses on the establishment and functioning of the university, including provisions for academic research, quality education, and national development. The amendments aim to enhance the educational and intellectual environment in the country, in line with the Interim Constitution of Nepal, 2063. The Act defines key terms such as "University," "Council," "Academic Council," and outlines the roles and responsibilities of various university bodies and personnel.
